remarks: An object A is said to be an initial object provided that for each object B there is exactly one morphism from A to B. Definition 7.1 in [Adamek] p. 101, or definition in [Lang] p. 57 (called "a universally repelling object" there).  (Contributed by AV, 3-Apr-2020.)
statement:
df-inito $p |- InitO = ( c e. Cat |-> { a e. ( Base ` c ) | A. b e. ( Base ` c ) E! h h e. ( a ( Hom ` c ) b ) } ) $.
$d a b c h $.
